content: What chemical element has the symbol 'Au' and is commonly used in jewelry due to its lustrous appearance?

The chemical element with the symbol 'Au' is gold. It is highly sought after for jewelry because of its attractive, lustrous yellow color, as well as its malleability and resistance to tarnish. Gold's dense and soft nature makes it easy to work with, allowing for intricate designs in jewelry-making. Additionally, its rarity and historical significance contribute to its value and desirability in various cultures around the world.
